pullRequest.body:
This removes `KleinFour` in favor of a class `IsKleinFour` and proves that any two `IsKleinFour` groups are isomorphic via any identity-preserving equivalence. In addition, we prove that a group of order 4 is not cyclic if and only if it has exponent two.

There are several advantages:

1. this provides a general API accessible by other groups
2. we prove some generic facts about groups of exponent two
3. it is easy to `@[to_additive]` everything

If we want, we can always redefine an explicit `KleinFour` group, and give it an `IsKleinFour` instance. In that case we probably want to make a bespoke type for it, so that it can be `to_additive`-ized.

---

I deleted the `KleinFour` definition (and related material) primarily because it doesn't allow for a `to_additive` version. I'm happy to revert that deletion though if it's preferred.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
Does this need to wait for [8723](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8723) or is it ready to go? Anyway thanks!

bors d+

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7051243764/job/19193699151)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7051243764/job/19193698697)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7051243764/job/19193698487)
I think that all the result up to here can go to a more basic file (where the exponent is defined?).

I considered that, but I felt it would be better here so as not to clutter that file with facts about exponent two. Most likely, if you want results about exponent two, you'll be interested in the Klein four-group anyway.

If you still think I should move it that's fine.

There is a zulip [discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/345428-mathlib-reviewers/topic/Klein.204) on making this a class or not. (I said to make it just a predicate, but I don't have a very strong opinion).
If `IsKlein` is a class this should be `simp`. Similarly below.
I think that's a bad simp lemma for a prop mixin class. Any time lean sees an inverse it will trigger TC synthesis for `IsKleinFour`
Fair enough. So let's add a comment explaining that this shouldn't be a global simp-lemma, but that it can be enabled locally when working with a Klein four group.
Ah, good point, I just added it as a scoped simp lemma.

```suggestion
  simp only [Set.mem_singleton_iff, Set.mem_insert_iff, mul_right_eq_self, mul_left_eq_self,
    mul_eq_one_iff_eq_inv, inv_eq_self_of_orderOf_eq_two hy, not_or]
  aesop
```
is a shorter version.

This statement is a special case of
```lean
lemma not_isCyclic_iff {p : ℕ} (hp : Prime p) (hG : Nat.card G = p ^ 2) :
    ¬ IsCyclic G ↔ Monoid.exponent G = p := by
```
Does it make sense to prove the more general one and deduce the current one from the general one?
Sure. I can do that.
This also holds with `p ^ n` (where `n > 1`). Maybe this can also be stated for a `PGroup` (but if it becomes too complicated let's keep this version for the PR).
Riccardo, I am not sure that I understand your comment: ℤ/4+ℤ/2 is not cyclic and does not have exponent 2.
It's too early in the morning, sorry.
I was thinking about the fact that the group is cyclic iff the exponent is the cardinality of the group.
@adomani I ended up splitting this off into #8723

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: abstract `KleinFour` into a class `IsKleinFour`.

source.title: feat(GroupTheory/SpecificGroups): define an isomorphism between a non-cyclic group of order 4 and the dihedral group of order 4
